1: <sup>1</sup> Remember, O LORD, what is come upon us: consider, and behold our reproach.
2: <sup>2</sup> Our inheritance is turned to strangers, our houses to aliens.
3: <sup>3</sup> We are orphans and fatherless, our mothers are as widows.
4: <sup>4</sup> We have drunken our water for money; our wood is sold unto us.
5: <sup>5</sup> Our necks are under persecution: we labour, and have no rest.
6: <sup>6</sup> We have given the hand to the Egyptians, and to the Assyrians, to be satisfied with bread.
7: <sup>7</sup> Our fathers have sinned, and are not; and we have borne their iniquities.
8: <sup>8</sup> Servants have ruled over us: there is none that doth deliver us out of their hand.
9: <sup>9</sup> We gat our bread with the peril of our lives because of the sword of the wilderness.
10: <sup>10</sup> Our skin was black like an oven because of the terrible famine.
11: <sup>11</sup> They ravished the women in Zion, and the maids in the cities of Judah.
12: <sup>12</sup> Princes are hanged up by their hand: the faces of elders were not honoured.
13: <sup>13</sup> They took the young men to grind, and the children fell under the wood.
14: <sup>14</sup> The elders have ceased from the gate, the young men from their musick.
15: <sup>15</sup> The joy of our heart is ceased; our dance is turned into mourning.
16: <sup>16</sup> The crown is fallen from our head: woe unto us, that we have sinned!
17: <sup>17</sup> For this our heart is faint; for these things our eyes are dim.
18: <sup>18</sup> Because of the mountain of Zion, which is desolate, the foxes walk upon it.
19: <sup>19</sup> Thou, O LORD, remainest for ever; thy throne from generation to generation.
20: <sup>20</sup> Wherefore dost thou forget us for ever, and forsake us so long time?
21: <sup>21</sup> Turn thou us unto thee, O LORD, and we shall be turned; renew our days as of old.
22: <sup>22</sup> But thou hast utterly rejected us; thou art very wroth against us.
